Introduction
For successful DMA measurements, it is extremely important to choose the "right" experimental parameters,
probably more so than in most other thermoanalytical techniques. In practice, the difficulty is that the
deformation mode, sample geometry and mechanical measurement parameters (force and displacement
amplitude) are interdependent. This article discusses important factors that need to be considered when
planning a DMA experiment.
